description: From French terrorisme, from terreur +‎ -isme, equivalent to terror +‎ -ism.
The word first appears in English in 1795 in reference to the Jacobin radicals of France, who ruled during the Reign of Terror.

entries.meaning: (historical) The system of fear and intimidation put into place during the Reign of Terror in Revolutionary France around 1793-94.

definitionGroups.group: The use of unlawful violence against people or property to achieve political objectives.

entries.meaning: (by extension) The use of intimidation or bullying tactics.
